body:
If I'm reporting this at the wrong place, let me know. I really don't know if Android Studio already had Dart support before adding this plugin.

## Steps to Reproduce

* Set dart code style as follows:  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14339291/75912405-ed8aec80-5e2f-11ea-96b9-83735f2e3cfa.png)
* Expectation:  
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14339291/75912546-2a56e380-5e30-11ea-9f0c-75d15750cc37.png)
* Reality:  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14339291/75912720-6db15200-5e30-11ea-8d5b-516ce5685858.png)

This is what the preview example shows (which is still not exactly what I want, but it is also not what `Ctrl+Alt+L` is doing):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14339291/75912447-ff6c8f80-5e2f-11ea-8af5-3d1c41999726.png)

## Version info


comment_data.body:
In-lining your versions here:

`Android Studio (version 3.6)`; `Flutter plugin version 44.0.2`; `Dart plugin version 192.7761`

> Set dart code style as follows:

In a newer version of the Dart plugin you won't see the standard IntelliJ options for formatting within dart files. We now delegate everything to `dartfmt` which doesn't allow for configuring the formatting behavior. There are many threads on that decision - the main reason being for consistency across Dart code generally.

Thanks for the feedback; I believe this is working as intended.

Oh well, alright then. I'll use their formatting.

Android Studio does show there is an update but when I click in "Update All (1)", nothing happens. I will try contacting Android Studio support for that.

Thanks!

Edit: just now I realised you meant in the future. The update I'm seeing must be another thing.

title: Dart ternary operation formatting not following code style
